definition: to celebrate the Chinese New Year
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: The dog died during the spring festival, and the dog skin is still on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 過年殺的狗肉早已喫光，狗皮一直掛在牆上。

sentences.english: People could only buy new clothes during the Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 只有過年，纔會有新衣裳。

sentences.english: Why all the New Year in the coldest winter?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼都是在最冷的冬天裏過年？

sentences.english: Mothers have bought clothes for them child. The clothes are very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽們會給孩子們買漂亮的衣服過年。

sentences.english: Some young men said they would take their girlfriend home to have dinner with parents on the Chinese New Year's Day。
sentences.chinese: 一些男士表示會帶女朋友回家過年。

sentences.english: At that time, most afraid of the Chinese Lunar New Year, a deserted home straight people cry.
sentences.chinese: 當時，最害怕過年過節，家裏面冷清得讓人直想哭。

sentences.english: Spring festival is approaching. In tradition, there will be a sacrifice for the lake and fish.
sentences.chinese: 快過年了，按老習俗當地要有一次祭湖祭魚的活動。

sentences.english: Carpooling is so hot before the Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 過年前拼車回家算是‘火’了。

sentences.english: But there are a lot of people in order to home for Chinese new year to buy the tickets and annoyance.
sentences.chinese: 但是又有很多人會爲了過年回家買車票的事而煩惱着。

sentences.english: For porters working at transfer posts, Spring Festival is the busiest time.
sentences.chinese: 在轉運站裏面工作的搬運工們過年的時候是最累的。

sentences.english: It seems that it has become a tradition for us to watch Spring Festival Gala on the Chinese New Year's eve.
sentences.chinese: 似乎已經成爲了一個傳統，大年三十守着春晚過年夜。

sentences.english: On the Eve of Chinese New Year, supper is a feast with families. The family will end the night with firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜，家人會一起喫年夜飯，過年時會放鞭炮。

sentences.english: The floor is not swept in case good fortune is swept out the door too.
sentences.chinese: 過年期間也不掃地，以免把福氣掃出了門。

sentences.english: Up the elevator stream the next few thousand people eager to get home for Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 不久，又會有幾千名急着回家過年的人擁進來。

sentences.english: The pot, and stove in my house are used only during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 我家的鍋竈只在過年的幾天用。

definition: to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
